note.ab: Gädam. It is considered a monastic community, but currently there are no monks. Local tradition speaks of "one thousand monks" who once resided around. At the foot of the mountain, there are collapsed structures of a rock-hewn church (?); some caves at the place of ascension to the church appear to be an old church or monks dwelling; a few other caverns in the rock on the other side are were used as burial places. Tabots (4): Michael, Gabriel, Mary, Täklä Haymanot.

16 Mss. photographed: TGM-001 “Four Gospels”; TGM-002 “Psalter”; TGM-003 “Loosening of the Spell”; TGM-004 “Book of the feast of Christs Baptism; Prayer of Insense”; TGM-005 “Missal”; TGM-006 “Missal”; TGM-007 “Missal”; TGM-008 “Vita of Arägawi”; TGM-009 “Book of the Absolution and other text”; TGM-010 “Miracles of Mary”; TGM-011 “Collection of Prayers”; TGM-012 “Horologium”; TGM-013 “Miracles of Jesus”; TGM-014 “Loosening of the spell”; TGM-015 “Homily of abba Jacob of Sarug”; TGM-016 “Book of the Funeral Rite”.
